qas.question: How many students are in Boston Public schools?
How many schools are in Boston?
What is the oldest public high school in the US?
What percentage of Bostons public students are African American?

context: The Boston Public Schools enrolls <a0_0>57,000<a0_0/> students attending <a1_0>145 schools<a1_0/>, including the renowned Boston Latin Academy, John D. O'Bryant School of Math & Science, and Boston Latin School. <a2_0>The Boston Latin School<a2_0/>, established 1635, is the oldest public high school in the US; Boston also operates the United States' second oldest public high school, and its oldest public elementary school. The system's students are 40% Hispanic or Latino, <a3_0>35%<a3_0/> Black or African American, 13% White, and 9% Asian. There are private, parochial, and charter schools as well, and approximately 3,300 minority students attend participating suburban schools through the Metropolitan Educational Opportunity Council.
